title: HR Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back, it was a pretty straight forward interview I think it took maybe about fifteen minutes total to go through the interview and then i was hired pretty easy
Interview Questions: What was your Past work experience

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Got interview within 1 day of submitting application. The interview is more about a conversation and easy. You get the feedback right away and process was explained thoroughly during the session.
Interview Questions: what you are best at?

title: IT Data Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: 1. First round was the phone interview 45 mins 2. Second round in person 2 hours 30 mins (almost 3 hours) technical (1.5 hour)+ Behavioral (1 hour) + tour (15 mins)
Interview Questions: 1. First round phone interview 45 mins (Basic database questions like types of primary key, normalization, Views). 2. Second round in person 2 hrs 30 mins (creating a database design, writing joins, stored procedure, finding error in sql query, behavioral questions) 3. Campus Tour

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: They flew me out to interview for the position and had me interview individually, by a group, and provide a presentation about the college. Overall it was an interesting, but also challenging experience.
Interview Questions: How would you respect diverse views in this position

title: HR Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: All virtual interviews, a series of questions related to the position. Very relaxed environment. and there was at least 4 different individuals involved in the interview. Let some time at the end for me to ask questions.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict in the office

title: Research Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Technical questions followed by your CV and project experiences . Project mentorship and project management related questions. Job skills and professional memberships and services. Project funding and coordination with various stakeholders including industry and other members
Interview Questions: What research projects that you handled

title: Clerkship Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington State University in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: There is an initial call to assess the phone number and personal demographics then schedule an interview with a panel of three or four members interviewing. Comfortable at ease during interview, friendly but official.
Interview Questions: Job scenarios for varied circumstances over an hour and a half to interview.

title: Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was quick and easy! There was one interview and it was only about 30 minutes long. Super easy process for an on-campus position! I would recommend interviewing with WSU to another student.
Interview Questions: Do yo I feel comfortable working in a diverse environment?

title: Personnel Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington State University (Spokane, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Quick phone interview with the manager, asked why I was interested in the role, basic questions about past experience, salary was talked about. Next was a zoom interview with a few team members, 30 min. Asked behavior questions, had time for me to ask questions as well. Salary is not negotiable, low pay (pretty much minimum wage) my experience and 4 yr degree was said to be taken into consideration however, I was still offered the lowest pay. The requirements for this role were only 2 yrs experience and no degree. The way the HR said I only qualified for the lowest pay didn’t add up to me. I didn’t move on to next step of interview process because the pay was too low and I didn’t want to waste my time or theirs.
Interview Questions: Describe some projects you’ve worked on. Do you have experience with workday? Lots of multitasking and questions about organizing your day and tasks Behavior questions Previous experience relevant to this job.

title: Cougar Connector Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds of interviews with a quick response time. The first round is a group interview, and the second round is one on one. The interviewers are encouraging and ask fair questions.
Interview Questions: What is one aspect you would change about WSU and why?

title: Student Educator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: It was very easygoing. I was interviewed by 3 current employees over zoom. I had faulty internet and not a terribly professional background because of the region I was in but they were accommodating.
Interview Questions: What is one time you assumed a position of leadership and how did you handle it?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: it was pretty standard. Just wanted to know undergraduate research and the things i was interested in. I have to have a 30 word minimum so i am going to type a bit more here and make this a really long sentance.
Interview Questions: research interests what did i do for undergrad research

title: Associate Director, Financial Aid Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interviews were well organized and structured, a lot of great input from multiple offices involved with the process, the financial aid office staff and director responsible for the search were friendly, gracious, and knowledgeable.
Interview Questions: Many standard questions such as managerial style and working with others as well as customer service techniques and how to manage unpopular change. Also diversity/equity/inclusion questions that are pretty standard nowadays.

title: Sales Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: quick, only one interview, and on zoom. Asked a few questions and then talked to the supervisor. Did not see campus till i started. It was an easy process, but didnt get a lot about the role.
Interview Questions: 2.	What do you think it takes to be successful in this field?

title: Lab Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: It was an 1 on 1 interview with the supervisor in the office. It was nothing special but he was asking about the resume and described about work. It was an easy interview I would say but he also asked about professional questions like how can he make an element with other elements
Interview Questions: All the things about resume

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: Very kind and open. I would describe the process as smooth and interesting. I enjoyed the company of my interviewer. I think I will continue working in this position for some time.
Interview Questions: How much do you know about coding?

title: IT ASSISTANT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: The supervisors here are local and pretty friendly and nice. I did the zoom interviews with my 2 supervisors for about 40 mins to an hour. Only one term of the interview and after two days, you will know the result.
Interview Questions: Like how familiar with your IT skills for each systems? What will you do if you can't solve a technique problem instead of looking for others to assist you?

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: it was challenging interview. mostly focus on IT and mobile applications platfor it was challenging interview. mostly focus on IT and mobile applications platfor it was challenging interview. mostly focus on IT and mobile applications platfor
Interview Questions: how much do you about the library systems

title: Mail Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very easy going and I was hired fast. The lady who oversees the mailroom is very sweet. I would recommend this job to anyone. They work with your schedule very well.
Interview Questions: What are your main values?

title: Paraprofessional Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: Simple, two rounds of interviews, just be yourself, they are just looking for someone who can be trained you do not have to be perfect, talk slowly because the interviewers have to take notes by hand
Interview Questions: Tell us a little about yourself

title: Circulation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington State University (Vancouver, WA) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was over zoom and was super easy and simple. They ask you basic interview questions and put you in a scenario situation as well to hear your response. Overall an easy process and they are super friendly and nice
Interview Questions: What are your strengths in a professional setting?

title: Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: Experienced no issues. Was given adequate time to explain my qualifications. Questions given were done so in a positive manner. Given proper respect as an individual. I applied to many positions across WSU campus and never experienced any difficulty as a student employee.
Interview Questions: What skills or training do you think would be beneficial to fulfilling the duties of this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview for the research assistant was an initial application followed by an informal interview with a graduate student. Asked questions about education, major, reasons they would be a good fit.
Interview Questions:
What is your interest in research?
How will you make an adequate contribution?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews with six to ten questions each. Everyone was friendly. Each interview had a hall director or assistant hall director and a resident advisor present. This year interviews were virtual.
Interview Questions: Please tell me about yourself.

title: Assistant Vice President, Philanthropic Engagement & Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Washington State University (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview experience was positive, friendly and informative. I appreciated how transparent and down to earth the recruiter was. The role sounded great but the salary was not a fit, unfortunately.
Interview Questions: General questions about my background and experience. This was a screening interview and due to the salary constraints we didn't go further.

title: Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: It was a multi-stage process but was pretty easy. The interviewers were really nice and made me feel less nervous. I had in person interviews. They asked  purposeful questions relevant to the position and about my skills.
Interview Questions: How did you hear about this position?

title: Curriculum Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington State University (Spokane, WA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Applied Online. 

15 Minute Phone Screen with HR. Went over compensation scale for this position ( it is set by the State of Washington). You get a $1 an hour boost for having a Master's over a Bachelor's. 

30 Minute Video Interview with Manager and Associate Dean.
Interview Questions: Tell us why you are interested in the position. Specifically, what in your background makes you the best fit for this position?

title: Admission Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: They made you feel comfortable and asked questions where it revoked around the school and how much you love it. They also ask what is something you want to advocate during tours or when talking to students involving resources on camous
Interview Questions: What makes you fit for this position?

title: Research Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington State University (Spokane, WA)
Interview Descriptions:
First Step: I had a video interview, question were mostly based on the my previous experience and career goals 

Second Step: I was invited for an on-site interview. Had to give a presentation on my previous experience. In addition, I had one-on-one with a couple of people at the research lab.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: It was very formal. There were two interviews. At each interview, there was a panel that included at least six employees. The first interview was via phone. The second interview was face-to-face.
Interview Questions: What is your five-year goal?

title: Junior Web Development Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: Single meeting sitting down with the IT Supervisors. Total time of about 1 hour. Mainly focused on personality questions and background. One technical question to get an idea of thought process when solving a problem.
Interview Questions: Write Pseudocode or a design to run a street light.

title: Data Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at Washington State University (Jersey City, NJ) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: After applying, I was contacted to set up a zoom interview with a panel. The interviewers in the panel were very intelligent and impressive professionals. They asked very relevant questions related to the position and my skill set. Afterwards I was contacted to set up an on-site interview. Sadly I was unable to travel. Later I was contacted to set up an interview with the person who would be supervisor for the professional in this position. The interviewer was again very impressive and asked very relevant questions. I could tell he would be a great boss to work for. I was offered the position after this interview. Sadly, I had to decline the offer due to my health issues. But had it not been for my health issues, I would have accepted the offer and worked for such a wonderful institution and great group of professionals. This job was wonderful and matched with my skill set. The overall interview process was very impressive and the hiring department was great.
Interview Questions: Questions very relevant to the position were asked, specially my Data Analytics and related experience.

title: Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Starts off with the application, then the work-study manager will send you an email about setting up a phone call. After the phone call the manager will reach out to you after a couple of days and let you know if they would like to give you an offer or not.
Interview Questions: Given the amount of information, you will need to look over are you able to be confidential?

title: Microbiologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington State University in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had a zoom interview and was offered the job about a week and a half later. I was interviewed by a panel of three people who took turns asking questions and taking notes on my answers.
Interview Questions: They asked about my experience with automated lab equipment

title: Technical Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Nice people for interview  make it  super relaxing and not much pressure. Standard questions. Engaging content and great people to work with in a great small town. Highly recommend working with some very dynamic individuals.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness when working on a team?

title: Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very professional and provided me an opportunity to ask questions and learn about the college and the university. The interview took about an hour and during this time there was an opportunity to ask questions and discuss my professional goals.
Interview Questions: How would you describe your approach to handling conflict.

title: Cougar Connector Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: In person interview. The process took 3 weeks. began working 4 months after interviewing. There were 2 rounds of interviews for the job. First round was a group interview and the second was with 4 different memebers of professional staff.
Interview Questions: What does it mean to be a Coug?

title: Nursing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington State University (Tacoma, WA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had in-person interviews. They asked purposeful questions relevant to the position and about my skills. The whole process very comfortable to me. The questions are not really hard for me and the people are very nice.
Interview Questions: why you choose this major?

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: First was the 30 min phone interview. After a week they contacted me for an in-person. The interview was a whole day. We started off with interview with the search committee. Then an hour presentation including Q&A. Then more sessions with the department and library staff.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job?

title: Scientific Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a 30 minutes meeting with the search committee, including 4 persons.  They asked  about 10 or 15 question about me and my attitude toward that position.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had supervisory experience?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very much to make sure I was a good fit in my designated lab. I was introduced to all the other lab members and office staff.
Interview Questions: What are you research interests?

title: Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied for this job from the WSU careers website. After a month I got an email regarding a phone interview. I gave the phone interview. Then got selected for an on-site interview. In the on-site interview, the first part was behavioral questions then they asked to design a database. They also asked me to bring the code sample related to database and client-server to discuss. After that, the next step was the background check. Finally got the offer.
Interview Questions: In the phone interview, they asked about previous relevant work

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: After the assessment of the submitted document, a virtual interview was scheduled with two faculty and a graduate coordinator. The interview took about 35 - 45 min. It was about my educational background, research and work experience.
Interview Questions: What will be my contribution if I'm accepted to the program?

title: Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with three individuals, followed by an in-person panel interview with five.  Interview questions were relatively straight-forward, with only one curveball question that more or less was easy to BS, and primarily to prove that one could think on their feet.
Interview Questions: What interests you about this position?

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Washington State University in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was very quick and they essentially hired you on the spot. You need to bring the identification from the house as well as other important documents in order for them to have the information to be able to hire you and sign forms
Interview Questions: Do you want to work here?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington State University in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Honest and thorough! A great experience. The team is about 6 people and all are passionate about what they do, You will likely meet with most of them in the process. The campus is beautiful but know that you will likely have to pay for parking.
Interview Questions: What are the things most important to you in the workplace?

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview with hiring manager with a tour of the facility.  We talked for about 30 minutes and they said they would get back to me. Only took about a week to hear back.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do when you graduate?

title: Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: They will meet with you and ask you general questions about working with customers and some general technical questions that aren't too difficult. You don't have to have a tech background as they hire people with no experience at all.
Interview Questions: If you walked into your hows and flipped the light switch, and it didn't turn on, what would you do?

title: Stockroom Assistant/Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to apply online through an email. I entered in my information and a copy of my class schedule. I received an email asking me to schedule an interview. The interview was laid back and quick. The most important part was having an open schedule to be able to schedule time slots to work.
Interview Questions: How many hours would you like to have

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: You will have short interview with your potential advisor in his/her office. After the conversation, you may have the chance to visit the lab with the PI. At the end of the interview, you will be told that when you will hear the decision about the offer.
Interview Questions: Basically, just introduce your research experience and interest.

title: Building Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was emailed to schedule an interview. The interview was 1 on 2 and involved about 10 questions. I received a job offer for the next semester within a week and accepted. Note that you must apply in advance and there is a window of opportunity that applications are accepted. They also require you to attend an information session before applying.
Interview Questions:
What is the role of the CUB on campus?
What is the role of a Building Manager?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: Somewhat brief, a lot of preparation was due before an interview was granted. Brought me in for an in person interview and they called me later that day with the offer
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict?

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: Very good and efficient interview process. Very professional panel of interviewers. Very fast results if you get or not get the job. Very good questions from panel of interviewers and future supervisor.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Resident Advisor (RA) Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Low stress interview essentially focused on your ability to empathize with others and work as part of a team towards a common goal. Typically there will also be a role play scenario.
Interview Questions: How do you approach situations where you have limited information to act on?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Washington State University in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
they ask the usual behavioral questions and have a good elevator pitch about yourself.
overall it isn't hard if you study the position.
be ok with not being paid for doing extra work
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you...

title: Network Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Remote initial with search committee, then onsite the search committee as well as others from the department.  Great experience good questions, they seemed genuinely interested in your background and what you may be able to bring in knowledge wise.
Interview Questions:
Hardest system you had to integrate.
Basic up to advanced networking knowledge.
PC Knowledge.
Windows Server, Exchange questions.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I emailed professors who had labs if they had empty spots, and they made me come in to ask about my educational background and the hours I could work. It was pretty chill, but as long as you show great interest and passion in what they’re researching, you’ll be fine.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds of interviews, with the first being a zoom interview. Panel comprised of 6 people for each interview. Interviews lasted about an hour. Questions were standard, although they had multiple scenario questions that seemed silly. Each person in panel asked a question and left time at the end of the interview for you to ask questions.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict with a colleague?

title: SolidWorks Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: Submit a Cover Letter and Resume and they get back to you in a week or two if you are hired or not. If they are they will ask when you are available and set everything up for you.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Technical Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very general questions were asked. It was less than thirty minutes. My answers were jotted down by the interviewers, and the interview took place in an office with two employees.
Interview Questions: How do you define success?

title: Dining Hall Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was very laid back. Management greeted me well. We talked about my previous positions at jobs and what I did before, what I am studying and what I would like to do at Hillside Cafe.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Pretty in-depth interview for this type of job.  I interviewed with a panel of about 12 people followed by an interview with the Chair of the department then the Dean of the college I was interested in working for.   The entire process from application to interview took about 2 months but the interviews themselves, aside from the initial phone interview, took place on the same day one right after the other.
Interview Questions: The obvious, what interested you in this particular job.

title: Tech Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: I met with the principal investigator who asked very brief questions and general interest in the scientific departments. Also asked me questions relating to the department I was in which was wheat genetics.
Interview Questions: Do you know how to extract DNA?

title: Assistant Hall Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Washington State University in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: There's an online application first and it is reviewed by hiring staff before your interview. Your interview is usually a few weeks later with a central staff member and a residential education director. Then a few weeks after that, you are notified whether you got the job or not.
Interview Questions: What is the type of hall and/or community you would most benefit?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: They did a screening interview that was over the phone. They asked good questions, but were not organized and didn't seem to know what they were looking for. They were nice. I think they could have asked a few more questions.
Interview Questions: What do you think this position entails?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Washington State University (Richland, WA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied for admission into the University and then university offered me the fully funded scholarship with an assistantship. The scholarship included a full tuition waiver and medical insurance. They went through my profile and an interview for the selection of the scholarship.
Interview Questions: What was my future plan about the research,, my previous experience in this field

title: Tech Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Washington State University (Spokane, WA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Emailed to set up an on campus interview. One hour long interview with a group of three. Received a call for acceptance later that week. Overall a good interview proccess.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have that would help for tech support?

title: Data Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: onsite interview, asking question all about behavior, no skill questions. 3 manager and 1 director of different areas asking questions in a row and it lasted for 1 hour. Before interview, the administrator sent out a file about the skills/ qualifications they were looking for in the onsite interview.
Interview Questions: what's your strength and weakness?

title: Food Service Worker Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Asked about what experience you have in the kitchen including, equipment used, knowledge of proper food handling techniques, leadership. after the interview I received a call with an offer an accepted.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in a kitchen environment?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: Didn't qualify, yet had past experience with customer service/clerical/admistrative duties as a manager. (5 Yrs) Washington State University is not an Equal Employment Opporunity Employer, very selective who they hire, STAY AWAY.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Fiscal Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Ellensburg, WA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: 1 hour telephone screening interview with 12 questions. Two people interviewed me and their questions were pertinent and job focused. It will take 1 year to become familiar with their fiscal cycles. They will bring to campus and do a second interview with finalists. A lot of support and training will be offered to hiree.
Interview Questions: How to solve employee relation difficulties.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Easy. If they call you in for an interview, you have 80% of getting it. They didn't even ask me any questions, but a list of all responsibility I will have
Interview Questions: When can you start

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: I emailed professors and called the department chair to see if I could get in. This school has some of the most friendly department coordinators of any university I applied to. They were not condescending towards my current status, as were a lot of the other D1 schools, and were extremely helpful.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to get a PhD?

title: Records Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted roughly a month later. The interview itself was four hours with the initial hour dedicated to a literal test. This was followed by a panel interview with five staff members who I would be working with, then a one on one with my potential supervisor, then another panel interview with three senior staff. Overall, the interview was tiring with each interviewer asking the same set of questions.
Interview Questions: Define data integrity

title: Chinook Building Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two interview. First interview focused on university recreations values and mission. Second interview focused on technical skills listed in the job description. Questions in the first interview were very repetitive
Interview Questions: How would you go about informing patrons about facility policies?

title: Social Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview followed up by an in person interview later. Great experience getting to know the manager of the social media department at Washington State University information technology services. Questions were thoughtful more about personality.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Friend and great to talk with. Dress professionally and be positive. After you can dress casually. Simple and precise. Be yourself and be open with availability times as a student, they will be flexible with your schedule and encourage you to put your degree first and foremost
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very simple. There is physical application that you fill out with you personal information, academic information, and the classes you want to tutor in. Then, you respond to two short essay questions on why you want to be a tutor as well as what you hope to get out of it. A few days later, you should get a call to either set up a quick interview or tell you that they did not need the classes you offered to tutor in.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a tutor?

title: Northside Residence Hall Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions:
From what I can remember the first year I applied, it was a phone interview that lasted about ten to fifteen minutes. The questions were situation based like "what would you do if...." or "how would you respond to...."
It wasn't difficult, they just wanted to see you think and respond appropriately to possible situations on the job. I believe they also asked questions about your personality and customer service experience.
Interview Questions: "how would you respond to this situation?"

title: Secretary Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied through WSU website and receiving phone call for onsite interview several weeks later. On-site was a panel interview with 3 staff. Fairly casual. Questions were easy and experience, situation based.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize work?

title: PhD Position In Mechanical Engineering Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: I contacted with my current supervisor through email. I had pointed out my research experience from my BS and MS degree. As our research experience matched my supervisor replied me asking several questions related to my MS research and my knowledge on several software.
Interview Questions: Questions relevant to my research.

title: Facilities Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Richland, WA)
Interview Descriptions: the interview went good, as usual, the basic questions were asked. The people are friendly, but when you actually start the job I found out I do not have a supervisor, only an assistant director who will micromanage and control you every second that she has. Please avoid this job!
Interview Questions: Basic questions

title: IT Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was somewhat long, they started with a phone screen interview followed by a several hour in person interview. The questions were not hard, the process was overall just time consuming.
Interview Questions: What would I do if a USB stick didn't appear when I plugged it in?

title: Payroll Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was simple. They were sort staff and needed people as soon as possible. I was hired the same day I interviewed with them. If by any chance you come across the position, steer clear and look else where. You'll regret working here!
Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit for this position?

title: Market Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was set at the company's main office.  I was not asked to prepare anything ahead of time aside from bringing a resume for review.  For the interview, I was questioned by four employees on things ranging from my problem solving skills to what I would do in certain situations.  The questions were roughly 55% HR and 45% technical and problem solving.
Interview Questions: What kind of strategies do you use to prioritize your work?

title: Academic Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Spokane, WA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a one hour interview between the department chair and two faculty who work in the department. They asked pretty typical questions. The whole process was quick and different from the other higher ed interviews I had in the past.
Interview Questions: Please describe a time you had to collaborate with others on campus to implement a student success event.

title: Managing Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Richland, WA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by 4 Senior Administrators on the WSU campus. I was asked questions by each interviewer. The questions were prescripted and each pe3rson took turn reading down the list.
Interview Questions: Have you read the job posting and can you successfully complete all of the requirements posted?

title: Information Technology Specialist III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
We had a quick question and answer followed by me demo'ing some code I had brought to present.  The interview was a very low stress environment and only took one interview to complete.  

The length before hearing back was almost 2 months, very very frustrating when you are unemployed waiting for responses.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite programming language, what do you like about it and what are its weaknesses.

title: IT Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: A panel of 5 of my coworkers interviewed me in a round robin Q&A for 30 minutes.  Afterwards they asked if I had any questions for them, which took 30 more minutes.
Interview Questions: Define VLAN and LAN.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy interviewing process as they needed a graduate student to fill the position pretty quickly. Interviewed with teaching staff. I was offered the job on the spot, and was very happy to receive it after being concerned about getting a goo graduate teaching position.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you.

title: Service Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: There are typically two rounds of interviews. The first round is most often held by college students/peers/employees that are "like you" then the 2nd and final interview will be with a hiring manager.
Interview Questions: what are your core values

title: Events Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I completed and online application, then I was alerted a month later to the opportunity for a video interview, I was then interviewed by 4 potential coworkers round robin style, after which I was informed I would be contacted should I be chosen for the job to schedule a background check.
Interview Questions: How do you feel you could contribute to our team?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Spokane, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Required about a year of nursing experience. They are almost always short on graduate TAs in their nursing program. Tuition waiver covers all in-state tuition for each semester employed. I expressed interest in the TA position to the director of undergraduate nursing and they were happy to take me on as a teaching assistant, virtually no questions asked beyond ensuring I had at least a year of nursing experience.
Interview Questions: Must maintain full-time status to maintain TA status. There were no interview questions, I was hired solely because of my status as grad student and 2+ years of nursing experience. Because of the lax requirements for becoming a TA, many graduate teaching assistants were severely unfit for their teaching roles.

title: Systems Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was a single interview with a panel  of 4 members. The interview lasted about 40 and consisted of about 4 or 5 technical questions. Easy going group of people and the questions were well formed.
Interview Questions: how do you find the most frequent value in an array of integers.

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I am an international student so I got an email from my current Advisor with offer to join his research program. We mainly communicated through the email before I arrived, after I got to Pullman we talked about the research possibilities and he allowed me to choose the directions I would like to go during my PhD. Overall experience about the interview is very positive and didn't feel very hard. People seem supportive and open
Interview Questions: What research area I am interested in? What is my future plans after graduation?

title: Fiscal Analyst I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview took place with a panel of a current departmental director, supervisor, and analyst.  They took turns asking questions off of an HR-approved list that dealt with my skills, prior experience, and expectations.  It lasted around 20 minutes and ended with a skills assessment test taken alone in Excel and a tour around the office.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time where you worked on a project that did not have the desired outcome.  What went wrong, and how did you correct this?

title: Technical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very easy hiring process. Consisted of only one interview on site with the team. They were not intimidating and made me feel comfortable throughout the whole process. It was a relatively short interview, which began with a brief summary of the position itself and then flowed into the candidates skill set and qualifications.
Interview Questions: Very basic interview questions were asked. Such as your work experience, interests, how you handle certain workplace situations.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online at cougsyn.com, uploaded resume and cover letter, was contacted few weeks later. The interview was a group interview, current lab members were present. Questions regarding classes taken, previous experience, and whether graduate school was in future plans were asked.
Interview Questions: What classes have you taken? Do you have research or laboratory experience? Are you a STEM major? Do you want to go on to graduate school? Where do you see yourself in 5-10 years?

title: IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Did a phone interview first, then they contacted my references and then did an in person interview. Overall it was very quick, only took 3 weeks from the first phone interview.
Interview Questions: Asked about my IT knowledge

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions:
email to apply for job, phone interview, on site interview, mainly about technical questions, 
ask about how long would plan to work here, the long term future goals, any ideas about what will be done
Interview Questions: Most of questions are as expected

title: Parking Enforcement Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: They ask a lot about how you would handle situations with angry pedestrians and with the weather. The job itself is harsh only because the environment that you find yourself working in. But there's definitely places you can find yourself to get warm during the winter months. You also tend to understand why tickets are written after working there. People pay a lot of money for parking spaces which get taken up by people who didn't pay. They're written to be fair to the people who had to pay in the first place.
Interview Questions: If an angry patron confronts you while writing a parking ticket, what do you do?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Eugene, OR) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
This position was at the discretion of program head and was based on portfolio and references as opposed to a selection committee.

The program head reviewed my application package which included a letter of intent, CV, teaching philosophy, references and a portfolio of practice work as well as academic/research work.
Interview Questions: What classes have you taught prior to coming to WSU.

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: skype with professor in Washington state university, then he asked me to send him my official grades, then he approved and the department sent me the offer letter and then another interview with the professor when I came to wsu
Interview Questions: my research interests and my background

title: Director of Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview was simply and to the point. Panel interview with the President and Vice President. Answered questions regarding my experience and capabilities as well as my goals for the university. Heard back within one week from the interview.
Interview Questions: Asked to explain my finance experience.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: Apply on December and got offer on April
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: simple and easy ...send application along with GRE scores etc. you will get offer based on your GPA, GRE and recommendation letters
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got an email to set up an interview a month later. I was interviewed by a panel. They took turns asking pretty standard questions from a list about my abilities related to the job, why I was different from other candidates etc. Despite reading questions from a list, they were very friendly. They emailed me the same day to say I was a finalist and that they were doing reference checks and a background check. I received an offer within a week.
Interview Questions: In what areas do you need improvement?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Was advised by my teacher to become a teaching assistant in which I decided it would be nice to teach a class for a semester and revisit the fundamentals. I was given an aptitude test which tested my knowledge of the programming language "C" and also tackled concepts like recursion and pointers.
Interview Questions: Hanoi's tower

title: Interior Design Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was one group meeting with all the interior design project managers I would work under. They reviewed my resume and portfolio. Asked that I present my projects and explain them. They talked a little about what the job entails and stated that we would be in touch.
Interview Questions: They wanted to know how well I could draft on AutoCAD since that is the program they use most heavily.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Washington State University (Wenatchee, WA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I worked at WSU before as a graduate student, and my postdoctoral research was somehow related to the work I have done before, so my interview was not very hard and the whole process was short.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume with proper individuals in their respective departments.  Was selected for an interview.  Asked for 2-3 references.  Contacted references and was offered position.  In December a limited number of students are on assistantships... So the pool is limited...
Interview Questions: What do you expect to gain out of this assistantship?

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a multi-staged process. First was a group interview followed by a 1:1 with the director if you were selected to move on. Follow up on an offer was quick.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions related to how your previous experience would help you in the position and what your career goals were. Be prepared to bring a portfolio.

title: Engineering Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Staff and Faculty members met me in a conference room and gave me a tour to the laboratories that I will need to manage. They were very nice and polite. Also they informed me on their decision the same day, but it took another 6 weeks to process the paper work.
Interview Questions: Are you are self-starter?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Washington State University (Spokane, WA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Typical Graduate student interview consisting of transcript and application processing and face to face on campus interview.  All attending interviewers were professional, interesting, and very engaging during the interview process.
Interview Questions: What in particular would you like to focus your dissertation research in that would benefit our program?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington State University
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume online and got the phone interview. Got the offer after the phone interview.
Interview Questions: It is very competitive. You have to be productive and creative to survive.

title: Administrative Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: very simple questions were asked over the phone. Then there is a group interview followed by one on one interview. telephonic interview four people asked me 4 different question. one of them was how I will think out of the box. I asked them to provide me with a situation. Which they did.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Extension Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 9 months. I interviewed at Washington State University in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: The application process is coordinated 100% online.  Make sure your digital documentation is up to par and in PDF format for best results in submitting.  Be prepared to wait.  WSU is much like any higher ed institution hiring processes, which take a great deal of time.  They are slow to hire but employment is stable and the benefits are great!
Interview Questions: What are your plans your first day of work?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I doubt my experience will be helpful to anyone else as I got this position through faculty contacts and not through a typical application process. My interview was very informal because the faculty members were already familiar with my research. They mainly just wanted to know if I could do CGE modeling.
Interview Questions: There were really no difficult or unexpected questions.

title: Cougar Connector Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview with three other students and a panel of Admissions and Recruitment staff as well as current lead Cougar Connectors/Graduate Assistants asking questions. The interview lasted for about 30 minutes or so.
Interview Questions: If a parent asks about partying at Washington State University, how would you handle it without endorsing underage drinking or partying?

title: Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with Head Manager, in her office, pretty casual, she mostly just asked about my related experience and my availability. She introduced me to the person I would shadow for a semester and he and I got along really well, i heard back within the week.
Interview Questions: Related experience

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted in February and offered a private contract.
Interview Questions: Do think you can complete the two year program in one year?

title: Fiscal Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Application, phone interview, in person interview with panel of 3 people - 20 minutes - then tour of the department. Straight forward questions. It took long to hear back but the process was very smooth and everyone was very nice. Application, phone interview, in person interview with panel of 3 people - 20 minutes - then tour of the department. Straight forward questions. It took long to hear back but the process was very smooth and everyone was very nice.
Interview Questions: Describe what your role would be on a team

title: Library Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very very casual, and also very brief. It took less than 20 minutes. Some of the basic Human Resource type interview questions were asked. They then outlined what some of the job requirements are and what the daily tasks that I would be doing were. Finally, they asked for my availability and I was well on my way.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Marketing/Promotions Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was first contacted by phone to set up a phone interview, which was round one. That included 2-3 interviewers on the other end. Second round was an on-campus interview. They flew me out to Pullman (from the midwest) and provided lodging at a nice hotel. The interview was half a day and consisted of first an interview with 3 interviewers; the same from the phone. Next I met the office director and had an informal interview with her. After that I was given 15 minutes to prepare for and give a presentation on a marketing plan/ideas based on a provided topic/question/issue. The presentation was 30-minutes presenting, 15 minutes for Q&A and anyone from the office was welcome to attend. My presentation had about 20 of 70 in the office attend. After that I was given a short tour of the town and concluded with lunch at a local restaurant. I flew back out of town that evening.
Interview Questions: They followed the position description asking for examples of my experience handling those responsibilities, "STAR" questions that would apply to position description relevant situations, and a handful of questions related to the position responsibilities and my resume' listed experiences. Of course near the end there were also a few personal questions; why WSU, why our department, personal goals for the role if offered.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: The people in the Office are very helpful and understanding. They will help you in any way they can. I was asked if I could work with websites and help with technology needs.
Interview Questions: If I can create the tabs needed in the websites.

title: Director of SLA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: The process was long with a lot of steps.  It was not very difficult just long periods of time with little or no communication from WSU. Didn't really know where everything was at until I finally got a call back asking me to come interview.
Interview Questions: Do you support diversity?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submit the resume and they will ask for interview. Done interview and you go
Interview Questions: It's pretty easy

title: Honeybee Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Short interview, mostly discussed past landscaping experience and whether or not I was afraid of bees or being stung. Was interviewed by the guy who became my supervisor, who is an awesome guy.
Interview Questions: Are you prepared to be stung often?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is based on your relationship with faculty.
Interview Questions: How do you plan to pass the CPA exam?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: My interview was laid-back and non-threatening, but did include very technical questions.  The people involved included my new manager, a soon-to-be colleague, and other members of the tech team. Each of them were fully prepared with relevant questions, geared both toward my working knowledge of software development and my views on employment in the field.
Interview Questions: I was given a somewhat mathematical software "problem" to solve.  I do not remember the exact details, but it involved a good amount of interpretation as to what the best approach would be to find a solution that both produced accurate results and accomplished the (somewhat vague) objectives.  While proving to be difficult, this problem was an excellent example of problems actually found on the job, and sparked a good deal of discussion between myself and the people interviewing me.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: panel interview - they had a sheet and each asked a question - it was elementary to say the least and looking back now, I should have trusted my gut feeling that this was a dump - Research and teaching presentation - the search committee chair stopped me because she was hungry - I kid you not. Also they lost some of my documents and asked me to bring hard copies along - which I did... so many signs that I should have listened to....
Interview Questions: describe your team work skills -

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process starts (after the online application process) with a day's worth of group activities. These group activities are mainly team-building and ice breaking focused activities. Then, there is the small panel-style interviews (one applicant, three to four interviewers) with specific questions asked. All in all, it's a fairly easy interview as long as you specifically tell them your strengths, weaknesses, etc. They're primarily looking to see that you're level headed, have a great personality, and are open to meeting new people.
Interview Questions: Say that there are two different situations within your community that requires your attention (at this point, they specifically told me the two different situations regarding residents). Which situation will you address first and why?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: application first and then phone interview followed by on site face to face interview the interviewers will select the candidates basing on their presentations and performance and ability and personality and skills
Interview Questions: do you like research

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Basically the boss just talked about his/her projects. What he/she want you to be finished if you are hired. Make sure you are interested in his/her projects. If you have the skills he/she is looking for, such as running western blot for examples, it's will be a plus. After talking, he/she will bring you to his/her lab. Let you meet other lab members. After that, he/she will ask his/her lab members whether they like you. If so, you will get an offer.
Interview Questions: Talk about your experience and what's your plan.

title: Clerical Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: I filled out the Washington State University Jobx form.  I received an e-mail the next day asking me to call during select hours.  I called and had a phone interview.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous work experiences.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews one on the phone and second a detailed interview from 2 PHD researchers
Interview Questions: What is your expexted time to complete your individual training on the HPLC and Gas Chromatograph

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: i REALLY DONT WANT TO WRITE ANYTHING HERE. BUT THE INTERVIEW PROCESS WENT FAIRLY WELL, THEY ASKED A BUNCH OF QUESTIONS, I ANSWERED A BUNCH OF QUESTIONS. OVERALL THERE WAS A LOT OF QUESTIONS BEING ASKED AND ANSWERED. SOME QUESTIONS WERE GOOD QUESTIONS, SOME DIDN'T MAKE ANY SENSE AT ALL, AND OTHERS WERE JUST POINTLESS.
Interview Questions:
IF YOU WERE STRANDED ON A DESERT ISLAND AFTER A PLANE CRASH WITH A BUNCH OF STRANGERS LIKE IN LOST, WHAT TYPE OF CHARACTER WOULD YOU BE.
A. JOHN LOCKE
B. HURELY
C.SAIID
D. JACK SHEPARD
C. SAWYER

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Washington State University (Vancouver, WA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Simple questions
Interview Questions: Research Experience

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Washington State University (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: I visited the university 1 year before I finished my MS degree and met my adviser then. I emailed him my interest of being a graduate student working with him. Later I had the interview when both of us went to a conference. The whole process was smooth.
Interview Questions: Did you have a clear plan for the research project?

title: IT Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: No technical question was asked.
Interview Questions: are you a team player ?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. First was interviewed by phone by the hiring professor. Then followed the call from the department chair. After this was invited for a site visit. The site visit was 2 days. The first day included touring of the facilities, presentation and meeting people (10 overall). The offer was made next day during wrap up conversation and I accepted it.
Interview Questions: how do feel living in a small town community?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions:
Multiple interviewers.
First a basic check from a friend of the interviewer to determine if I understood some basic concepts of programming. Then to see if I could propose potential solutions to a primary task related to the job.
Second was with the people doing the hiring. These people knew what they wanted, but they didn't have any programming background, so questions were very open ended, and they asked that I teach them a basic concept of programming. From there hiring was quickly done.
Interview Questions: The only difficult question was one related to the field. How do you match up strings that overlap? The answer I provided didn't really answer the question, but was designed to see if I could understand a potential solution.

title: Event Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy.  Apply through WSU jobs website.  If you make the screening section, you will get an interview.  They are more worried about personality, as you will be working on a team.
Interview Questions: Tell us your weakness.

title: Food Server Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Sept 2008
Interview Descriptions: Just need to fill out some basic personal information. They don't really ask any questions to hire you.
Interview Questions: Have you worked for other dining places?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Washington State University (Richland, WA) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions: The newly recruited Director of the Center for Bioproducts and Bioenergy recruited me to come to work here to help start-up the center.
Interview Questions: Not really applicable. However, I was assured that I would have the opportunity to do my own research but that hasn't happened.

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Washington State University (Pullman, WA) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: This is a college job with the university so I emailed my resume to the P.I. She called me, we sat down and talked for 30 minutes and I started the job the next day.  Again it's not a real job so everything is very relaxed.
Interview Questions: There weren't any really serious questions.  The interview was just to make sure I would fit in with the lab.
